ratings.comment: If you explain your situation, he almost always understands.

Granted this a seminar, one credit course, it is easy and Dr. Klatt is very nice.  There are assignments due almost every friday and I forgot to do them once or twice and he was very understanding.  A great introduction to CALS.

If you are a CALS student, definitely take Inter-Ag 155 to fulfill your first year seminar requirement. The class is meant to help ease your transition to college and introduce you to all the campus resources that are available. Should be an easy A!

He leads the general lecture and heads up a small group too. Very clear and sends concise emails detailing what needs to be done. Entire course is extremely easy and should net you an A. Bi-weekly writing assignments and discussion, and some easy extra assignments. Great Professor, Easy class.

John was my small group leader for this class and he was very lenient on deadlines. Class is an easy A if you go and do the little bit of homework. John is one of the nicest people I've met in CALS and is eager to help you with anything you need.
Simple 1 credit class. All you have to do is show up, or even just swipe your card and say your going to the bathroom, then ditch. I preferred sleeping in the lectures but that is just me. Easy A
Very easy one credit seminar. Pretty useful for new students, lets you know what you need to do to succeed here. Seminars can be boring but attendance is taken.
The class didn't use a textbook. Fairly good at teaching you what it takes to succeed.

Interdisciplinary fall only course within CALS called Leadership Seminar 312.  Learn about leadership on a variety of levels.  2 papers in class with mandatory attendance. Easy class but above all, these skills you learn about yourself will help you through your lifetime. highly recommend it
